jparsec.graph

Class GridChartElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.graph.GridChartElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GridChartElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Creates a grid chart element to be later drawn by NOAA SGT graphic library, or SurfacePlotter.

    In this object the labels for x, y and z axes, as well as the title can be encoded following the instructions given in TextLabel class. This provides some possibilities like to change color/size, include superscript or subscript text, or greek letters.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • opacity

        public GridChartElement.OPACITY opacity
        Holds the opacity of the surface, only taken into account when creating the chart with VISAD.

      • pointers

        public java.lang.String[] pointers
        Sets the text of pointers in a grid chart. There are two possible formats:
        1. Physical position of the origin point of the arrow (x and y), physical position of the destination point, and the text. For example 0 0 1 1 Arrow from (0, 0) to (1, 1).
        2. Physical position of the point (x and y), type of mark, size of mark in physical units, and label text. Types of marks supported are C (circle outline) and CF (filled circle). For example 0 0 C 10 Circle at (0, 0) with diameter = 10.

      • ocultLevels

        public boolean ocultLevels
        Set to true to ocultate the level colors.

      • ocultLevelLabels

        public boolean ocultLevelLabels
        Set to true to ocultate the level labels inside the chart.

      • levelsOrientation

        public GridChartElement(java.lang.String title,
                java.lang.String x_label,

                GridChartElement.COLOR_MODEL colorModel,
                double[] limits,
                java.lang.Double[][] data,
                double[] levels,
                int width)
                 throws JPARSECException
        Simple constructor for a raster contour chart.
        Parameters:
        title - Title.
        x_label - X axis label.
        y_label - Y axis label
        legend - The legend.
        colorModel - Color model ID.
        limits - The limits for the x and y axes.
        data - The data.
        levels - The levels to show as contours.
        width - Chart width. Height is set automatically.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • resample

        public void resample(int w,
            int h)
              throws JPARSECException
        Resamples the image data to a different resolution using a high-quality 2d spline interpolation method (function ImageSplineTransform.resize(int, int)).
        Parameters:
        w - New width.
        h - New height.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • clip

        public void clip(double[] newLimits)
          throws JPARSECException
        Clips the current chart to a given set of new limits located inside the current ones. The new chart has the same grid size, everything is interpolated.
        Parameters:
        newLimits - The new limits (min x, max x, min y, max y).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getIntensityAt

        public double getIntensityAt(double x,
                    double y)
        Returns the intensity at certain position using 2d spline interpolation. Note the returned value will not agree exactly with the contour lines generated by SGT, but the difference should be always small and inside the level of uncertainty expected.
        Parameters:
        x - X position in physical units.
        y - Y position in physical units.
        Returns:
        The intensity.

                                      double[] y,
                                      double[] z)
                                               throws JPARSECException
        Returns an array of data from a given dataset. The dataset must define a rectangular surface.
        Parameters:
        x - The x values.
        y - The y values.
        z - The values in the 3rd axis.
        Returns:
        The data.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getSurfaceFromPoints

        public static GridChartElement getSurfaceFromPoints(DoubleVector[] points,
                                    int n)
                                             throws JPARSECException
        Creates a grid series given an irregular set of points that lies on it. This method uses an interpolation algorithm similar to a discrete Fourier transform, but more adequate to properly treat the 'holes'. If the points contain no holes and are sampled regularly it is recommended to use 2d spline interpolation with class ImageSplineTransform.
        Parameters:
        points - The array of points (x, y, z).
        n - The number of points in the x and y axis of the output regular profile.
        Returns:
        The series.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
